title: Akins, Thomas Beamish
details: Historian, first archivist of Nova Scotia

title: Archibald, Edith Jessie
details: Key figure in the Nova Scotian women's fight for the vote

title: Archibald, Samuel George William
details: Attorney General of Nova Scotia (1831-41), Chief Justice of Prince Edward Island (1824-28)

title: Archibald, Sir Adams George
details: Father of Confederation, Lieutenant-Governor of Manitoba and Northwest Territories (1870-72), Nova Scotia (1873-83)

title: Baldwin, Frederick Walker 'Casey'
details: Engineer, worked with Alexander Graham Bell, designed aircraft and hydrofoil

title: Belcher, Sir Edward
details: Canadian-born naval officer and surveyor, led 1852-54 Franklin search

title: Borden, Sir Robert Laird
details: Prime Minister of Canada (1911-20)

title: Bourinot, Sir John George
details: Clerk of the House of Commons (1880-1902), founder of Royal Society of Canada

title: Cameron, George Frederick
details: Poet and journalist

title: Chandler, Edward Barron
details: Father of Confederation, Lieutenant-Governor of New Brunswick (1878-80)

title: Chase, William Henry
details: Businessman and philanthropist, supported Nova Scotia universities

title: Christie, Robert
details: Politician and historian, wrote six volume "History of Lower Canada"

title: Collins, Enos
details: Privateer and entrepreneur, important role in development of Halifax

title: Cook, Captain James
details: Surveyed coast of Newfoundland (1763-67), Gulf of St. Lawrence and Nova Scotia (1758-62)

title: Cornwallis, Edward
details: Founder of Halifax (1749), Governor of Nova Scotia (1749-52)

title: Cosby, Admiral Phillips
details: Commander-in-Chief of the Royal Navy in the Mediterranean (1786-90)

title: Cunard, Sir Samuel
details: Founded a commercial empire of shipping, banking, lumber, land and coal

title: Dawson, Dr. George Mercer
details: Director of the Geological Survey of Canada (1895)

title: Dawson, Robert MacGregor
details: Political scientist, wrote text book "The Government of Canada"

title: Dawson, Sir John William
details: First President of the Royal Society of Canada, principal of McGill University (1855-93)

title: Desbarres, Joseph Frederick Wallet
details: First Lieutenant-Governor of Cape Breton (1784-87), charted coast of Nova Scotia

title: Dickey, Robert Barry
details: Father of Confederation

title: Fielding, William Stevens
details: Premier of Nova Scotia (1884-96), federal Minister of Finance (1896-1911, 1921-25)

title: Gesner, Abraham
details: Physician, geologist and author, first refined kerosene (1846)

title: Grant, George Monro
details: Educator and writer, principal of Queen's University (1877-1902)

title: Haliburton, Sir Arthur Lawrence (Lord Haliburton)
details: British army officer and civil servant

title: Haliburton, Thomas Chandler
details: Writer of humorous and satirical works

title: Hall, William Neilson
details: First person of African descent and the first Nova Scotian to be awarded a Victoria Cross, he has become a role model for the military

title: Henry, William Alexander
details: Father of Confederation

title: Howe, Joseph
details: Premier of Nova Scotia (1860-63), achieved responsible government in Nova Scotia

title: La Boularderie, Sieurs de
details: Louis-Simon (1674-1738), son Antoine (1705-71), Cape Breton settlers; flourished 1720-1747

title: Langford, Sam
details: Professional boxer, fought 1902 to 1923

title: Macdonald, Major Margaret Clothilde
details: Matron-in-Chief of the Canadian Nursing Service during World War I

title: Mascarene, Jean-Paul
details: Governor of Nova Scotia (1744), held Annapolis Royal against French (1744-46)

title: McCulloch, Reverend Thomas
details: Founder of the Pictou Academy (1816-38), first principal of Dalhousie College

title: McCully, Jonathan
details: Father of Confederation

title: McCurdy, John A. D.
details: First person to fly an airplane in the British Empire (Silver Dart, 1909)

title: McKay, Donald
details: World renowned designer and builder of clipper ships "Flying Cloud"

title: Membertou (Anli-Maopeltoog)
details: Grand Chief of Mi'kmaqs in Annapolis Valley; began the Mi'kmaq-French Alliance in 1610

title: Menou d'Aulnay, Charles de
details: Governor of Acadia (1647-50), organized colonies at Port-Royal and Saint John

title: Murdoch, Beamish
details: Lawyer, politician, author, wrote "Epitome of the Laws of Nova Scotia" (1832-33)

title: Murray, Rear Admiral Leonard Warren
details: Organized the Allies' North Atlantic Convoy System during World War II

title: Newcomb, Simon
details: Astronomer, United States Naval Observatory, director of the Nautical Almanac (1877-97)

title: Newton, Gilbert Stuart
details: Painter, member of the Royal Academy (1834-35)

title: Perkins, Simeon
details: Merchant, diarist, legislator (1765-99)

title: Pratley, Philip Louis
details: Canada's foremost designer of long-span highway bridges

title: Preston, Reverend Richard
details: Leading figure in Nova Scotia's Black community in the first half of the 19th-century

title: Ralston, James Layton
details: Federal Minister of National Defence (1926-30, 1940-44)

title: Richardson, Harriette Taber
details: Chief proponent of the reconstruction of the Port Royal Habitation

title: Ritchie, John William
details: Father of Confederation, Nova Scotia Supreme Court Justice (1870-82)

title: Rose, Marie Marguerite
details: Key figure in the initial phase of Black slavery in Canada and stood out among emancipated slaves in New France

title: Saunders, Margaret Marshall
details: Popular author of children's books

title: Savalette, Captain
details: Pioneer of "sedentary" fisheries of Acadia (1565-1610)

title: Thomas, William
details: Leading architect in pre-confederation Canada

title: Thompson, Sir John Sparrow David
details: Prime Minister of Canada (1892-94)

title: Thompson, Stanley W.
details: Pioneer of golf course architecture in Canada and abroad; creating many challenging and world renowned golf courses

title: Tory, Henry Marshall
details: Founder and President of Carleton College (1942-7), National Research Council president (1923-35)

title: Tupper, Sir Charles
details: Prime Minister of Canada (1896); Father of Confederation

title: Tupper, Sir Charles
details: Prime Minister of Canada (1896); Father of Confederation

title: Uniacke, James Boyle
details: First Premier of Nova Scotia under responsible government (1848-54)

title: Vetch, Samuel
details: Soldier, Governor of Nova Scotia (1710-17)

title: Wallis, Sir Provo William Parry
details: Royal Navy officer, participated in the capture of the USS Chesapeake (1813); War of 1812

title: Walters, Captain Angus J.
details: Fame and ability as a fishing captain brought international attention to the Atlantic Canadian fishery

title: Watts, George Edward
details: Vice-admiral in the Royal Navy, served in the War of 1812

title: Wentworth, Sir John
details: Lieutenant-Governor of Nova Scotia (1792-1808), built Government House in Halifax

title: Westphal, Philip
details: Admiral (1866) in the Royal Navy, served in America and Europe

title: Westphal, Sir George Augustus
details: Admiral (1863) in the Royal Navy, served in Battle of Trafalgar

title: White, Portia May
details: Acclaimed vocalist from Black Nova Scotian community

title: Wolseley, William
details: Admiral (1819) in the Royal Navy, served in the East Indies and Mediterranean

title: Young, John 'Agricola'
details: Farmer, scholar and merchant, agricultural reformer

title: Young, Sir William
details: Premier of Nova Scotia (1854-57, 1859-60), Chief Justice (1860-81)
